meanings.definition: The pursuit of pleasure and self-indulgence.
meanings.sent1: Her hedonism led her to spend all her money on luxurious vacations.
meanings.sent2: Some people criticize hedonism as being selfish and short-sighted.
meanings.sent3: His hedonism was evident in his love for decadent desserts.
meanings.sent4: In a world of responsibilities, her hedonism was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The hedonism of the party was contagious, making everyone let loose and enjoy themselves.

meanings.definition: The ethical theory that pleasure is the highest good.
meanings.sent1: Studying philosophy introduced her to the concept of hedonism.
meanings.sent2: Hedonism as an ethical theory has been debated for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The professor's lecture on hedonism was surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of complexities, hedonism offers a simple approach to ethics.
meanings.sent5: The allure of hedonism can be tempting, but its consequences must be considered.

meanings.definition: A person who believes that pleasure is the most important thing in life.
meanings.sent1: As a hedonism, he always sought out new experiences to satisfy his desires.
meanings.sent2: Being labeled a hedonism doesn't necessarily have a negative connotation.
meanings.sent3: The hedonism's carefree attitude towards life was both enviable and concerning.
meanings.sent4: She was known among her friends as the ultimate hedonism, always seeking joy in everything.
meanings.sent5: The hedonism's philosophy was simple: prioritize pleasure above all else.
